page.title: 07BILTON VILLAGE.
page.content: Bilton,situated about 2 miles S.W. of Rugby town centre was a separate village till 1929 when it became part of the town of Rugby. In Bilton,there are such shops as the Co-op and V.G. supermarkets,Aldermans the bakers,Granny's Pie Shop,a D.I.Y./ Book/Computor Software shop,material & clothing shops,hairdreseer,garage,fish and chip shop.chinese take-away,2 pubs butcher,betting shop and a social club There are also 2 banks,2 building societies and 1 insurance agent,as well as a doctors' surgery,health clinic,dentist and vet. Most of the buildings are 100 years old.Bilton Hall is 300 years old.The Lord of The Manor was once Joseph Addison.In the old days there would not have been many shops.There were rich people and poor working people. .
